member.name: T:Spring.Social.IApiBinding
member.summary: Base interface that may be implemented by API bindings. Provides a simple boolean tester that can be used to determine if the API binding has been authorized for a specific user.
member.author: Keith Donald
Bruno Baia (.NET)

member.name: P:Spring.Social.IApiBinding.IsAuthorized
member.summary: Returns true if this API binding has been authorized on behalf of a specific user.
member.remarks: If so, calls to the API are signed with the user's authorization credentials, indicating an application is invoking the API on a user's behalf. If not, API calls do not contain any user authorization information. Callers can use this status flag to determine if API operations requiring authorization can be invoked.

member.name: T:Spring.Social.IServiceProvider`1
member.summary: Top-level marker interface defining a ServiceProvider. A ServiceProvider provides access to a API that the application can invoke on behalf of a provider user.
member.remarks: For example, the FacebookServiceProvider could expose a FacebookApi that the application can invoke on behalf of Facebook user "Keith Donald". Defines a single parameterized type T representing a strongly-typed Java binding to the provider's API that can be obtained and invoked by the application. Does not define any operations since the provider authorization flow needed to construct an authorized API binding is protocol specific, for example, OAuth1 or OAuth2.
member.author: Keith Donald
Bruno Baia (.NET)

member.name: T:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ApiBinding
member.summary: Base class for OAuth1-based provider API bindings.
member.author: Craig Walls
Bruno Baia (.NET)

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ApiBinding.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs the API template without user authorization. This is useful for accessing operations on a provider's API that do not require user authorization.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ApiBinding.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs the API template with OAuth credentials necessary to perform operations on behalf of a user.
member.param: The application's consumer key.
The application's consumer secret.
The access token.
The access token secret.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ApiBinding.GetMessageConverters
member.summary: Returns a list of s to be used by the internal .
member.remarks: Override this method to add additional message converters or to replace the default list of message converters. By default, this includes a and a .
member.returns: The list of s to be used by the internal .

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ApiBinding.ConfigureRestTemplate(Spring.Rest.Client.RestTemplate)
member.summary: Enables customization of the RestTemplate used to consume provider API resources.
member.remarks: An example use case might be to configure a custom error handler. Note that this method is called after the RestTemplate has been configured with the message converters returned from GetMessageConverters().
member.param: The RestTemplate to configure.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ApiBinding.RestTemplate
member.summary: Gets a reference to the REST client backing this API binding and used to perform API calls.
member.remarks: Callers may use the RestTemplate to invoke other API operations not yet modeled by the binding interface. Callers may also modify the configuration of the RestTemplate to support unit testing the API binding with a mock server in a test environment. During construction, subclasses may apply customizations to the RestTemplate needed to invoke a specific API.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ApiBinding.IsAuthorized
member.summary: Returns true if this API binding has been authorized on behalf of a specific user.
member.remarks: If so, calls to the API are signed with the user's authorization credentials, indicating an application is invoking the API on a user's behalf. If not, API calls do not contain any user authorization information. Callers can use this status flag to determine if API operations requiring authorization can be invoked.

member.name: T:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ServiceProvider`1
member.summary: Base class for ServiceProviders that use the OAuth1 protocol. OAuth1-based ServiceProvider implementations should extend and implement .
member.author: Keith Donald
Bruno Baia (.NET)

member.name: T:Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1ServiceProvider`1
member.summary: A ServiceProvider that uses the OAuth 1.0 protocol.
member.author: Keith Donald
Bruno Baia (.NET)

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1ServiceProvider`1.GetApi(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an API interface allowing the client application to access protected resources on behalf of a user.
member.param: The API access token.
The access token secret.
member.returns: A binding to the service provider's API.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1ServiceProvider`1.OAuthOperations
member.summary: Gets the service interface for carrying out the "OAuth dance" with this provider. The result of the OAuth dance is an access token that can be used to obtain an API binding with method.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ServiceProvider`1.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1Operations)
member.summary: Creates a new AbstractOAuth1ServiceProvider.
member.param: The consumer (or client) key assigned to the application by the provider.
the consumer (or client) secret assigned to the application by the provider.
The OAuth2Operations template for conducting the OAuth 2 flow with the provider.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ServiceProvider`1.GetApi(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an API interface allowing the client application to access protected resources on behalf of a user.
member.param: The API access token.
The access token secret.
member.returns: A binding to the service provider's API.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ServiceProvider`1.ConsumerKey
member.summary: Gets the consumer (or client) key assigned to the application by the provider.
member.remarks: Exposed to subclasses to support constructing service API instances.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ServiceProvider`1.ConsumerSecret
member.summary: Gets the consumer (or client) secret assigned to the application by the provider.
member.remarks: Exposed to subclasses to support constructing service API instances.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AbstractOAuth1ServiceProvider`1.OAuthOperations
member.summary: Gets the service interface for carrying out the "OAuth dance" with this provider. The result of the OAuth dance is an access token that can be used to obtain an API binding with method.

member.name: T:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AuthorizedRequestToken
member.summary: An OAuth 1.0 request token that has been authorized by the user.
member.remarks: Constructed after the user grants the consumer application access to their data hosted at the service provider. This is typically achieved by the user clicking "Allow" over at the provider's site. The service provider returns a Verifier string in the authorization callback that must also be submitted in the access token request.
member.author: Keith Donald
Bruno Baia (.NET)

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AuthorizedRequestToken.#ctor(Spring.Social.OAuth1.OAuthToken,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an authorized request token.
member.param: The request token object.
The access token verifier.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AuthorizedRequestToken.Value
member.summary: Gets the request token value.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AuthorizedRequestToken.Secret
member.summary: Gets the request token secret.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.AuthorizedRequestToken.Verifier
member.summary: Gets the verifier string generated by the provider.

member.name: T:Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1Operations
member.summary: A service interface for the OAuth 1 flow. This interface allows you to conduct the "OAuth dance" with a service provider on behalf of a user.
member.author: Keith Donald
Bruno Baia (.NET)

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1Operations.BuildAuthorizeUrl(System.String,Spring.Social.OAuth1.OAuth1Parameters)
member.summary: Construct the URL to redirect the user to for authorization.
member.param: The request token value, to be encoded in the authorize URL.
Parameters to pass to the provider in the authorize URL. May be null.
member.returns: The absolute authorize URL to redirect the user to for authorization.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1Operations.BuildAuthenticateUrl(System.String,Spring.Social.OAuth1.OAuth1Parameters)
member.summary: Construct the URL to redirect the user to for authentication. The authenticate URL differs from the authorizationUrl slightly in that it does not require the user to authorize the app multiple times. This provides a better user experience for "Sign in with Provider" scenarios.
member.param: The request token value, to be encoded in the authorize URL.
Parameters to pass to the provider in the authenticate URL. May be null.
member.returns: The absolute authenticate URL to redirect the user to for authentication.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1Operations.FetchRequestTokenAsync(System.String,Spring.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Action{Spring.Rest.Client.RestOperationCompletedEventArgs{Spring.Social.OAuth1.OAuthToken}})
member.summary: Asynchronously begin a new authorization flow by fetching a new request token from this service provider.
member.remarks: The request token should be stored in the user's session up until the authorization callback is made and it's time to exchange it for an access token.
member.param: The URL the provider should redirect to after the member authorizes the connection. Ignored for OAuth 1.0 providers.
Any additional query parameters to be sent when fetching the request token.
The Action<T> to perform when the asynchronous request completes. Provides the temporary request token used for authorization and exchanged for an access token.
member.returns: A instance that allows to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1Operations.ExchangeForAccessTokenAsync(Spring.Social.OAuth1.AuthorizedRequestToken,Spring.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Action{Spring.Rest.Client.RestOperationCompletedEventArgs{Spring.Social.OAuth1.OAuthToken}})
member.summary: Asynchronously exchange the authorized request token for an access token.
member.param: An authorized request token and verifier. The verifier will be ignored for OAuth 1.0 providers
Any additional query parameters to be sent when fetching the access token.
The Action<T> to perform when the asynchronous request completes. Provides the access token.
member.returns: A instance that allows to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth1.IOAuth1Operations.Version
member.summary: Gets the version of OAuth1 implemented by this operations instance.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.OAuth1Template.AddCustomAuthorizationParameters(Spring.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary:
Allows to add custom authorization parameters to the authorization URL.
May be overridden to return any provider-specific parameters that must be passed in the request to the authorization URL.
member.remarks: Default implementation adds no parameters.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth1.OAuth1Template.CreateRestTemplate
member.summary: Creates the used to communicate with the provider's OAuth1 API.
member.remarks: This implementation creates a RestTemplate with a minimal set of HTTP message converters: . May be overridden to customize how the RestTemplate is created. For example, if the provider returns data in some format other than JSON for form-encoded, you might override to register an appropriate message converter.
member.returns: The RestTemplate used to perform OAuth1 calls.

member.summary: Gets a reference to the REST client used to perform OAuth1 calls.

member.summary: Gets the version of OAuth1 implemented by this operations instance.

member.summary:
Gets the consumer key to be read by subclasses.
This may be useful when overriding and the consumer key is required in the authorization request.

member.summary: Constructs the API template without user authorization. This is useful for accessing operations on a provider's API that do not require user authorization.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AbstractOAuth2ApiBinding.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs the API template with OAuth credentials necessary to perform operations on behalf of a user.
member.param: The access token.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AbstractOAuth2ApiBinding.GetOAuth2Version
member.summary: Returns the version of OAuth2 the API implements.
member.remarks: Subclasses may override to return another version.
member.returns: By default, returns OAuth2Version.Bearer indicating versions of OAuth2 that apply the bearer token scheme.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AbstractOAuth2ApiBinding.GetMessageConverters
member.summary: Returns a list of s to be used by the internal .
member.remarks: Override this method to add additional message converters or to replace the default list of message converters. By default, this includes a and a .
member.returns: The list of s to be used by the internal .

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AbstractOAuth2ApiBinding.ConfigureRestTemplate(Spring.Rest.Client.RestTemplate)
member.summary: Enables customization of the RestTemplate used to consume provider API resources.
member.remarks: An example use case might be to configure a custom error handler. Note that this method is called after the RestTemplate has been configured with the message converters returned from GetMessageConverters().
member.param: The RestTemplate to configure.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AbstractOAuth2ApiBinding.RestTemplate
member.summary: Gets a reference to the REST client backing this API binding and used to perform API calls.
member.remarks: Callers may use the RestTemplate to invoke other API operations not yet modeled by the binding interface. Callers may also modify the configuration of the RestTemplate to support unit testing the API binding with a mock server in a test environment. During construction, subclasses may apply customizations to the RestTemplate needed to invoke a specific API.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AbstractOAuth2ApiBinding.IsAuthorized
member.summary: Returns true if this API binding has been authorized on behalf of a specific user.
member.remarks: If so, calls to the API are signed with the user's authorization credentials, indicating an application is invoking the API on a user's behalf. If not, API calls do not contain any user authorization information. Callers can use this status flag to determine if API operations requiring authorization can be invoked.

member.summary: Creates a new OAuth2 access token.

member.summary: Creates a new OAuth2 access token.

The scope of the access grant.
The refresh token that can be used to renew the access token.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AccessGrant.AccessToken
member.summary: Gets the access token value.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AccessGrant.Scope
member.summary: Gets the scope of the access grant. May be null if the provider doesn't return the granted scope in the response.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AccessGrant.RefreshToken
member.summary: Gets the refresh token that can be used to renew the access token. May be null if the provider does not support refresh tokens.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth2.AccessGrant.ExpireTime
member.summary: Gets the (in UTC) when this access grant will expire. May be null if the token is non-expiring.

member.name: T:Spring.Social.OAuth2.GrantType
member.summary: OAuth2 supports two types of authorization flow, typically referred to as "Client-side" and "Server-side".
member.author: Roy Clarkson
Bruno Baia (.NET)

member.name: F:Spring.Social.OAuth2.GrantType.AuthorizationCode
member.summary: Denotes the server-side authorization flow, and is associated with the response_type=code parameter value.

member.name: F:Spring.Social.OAuth2.GrantType.ImplicitGrant
member.summary: Denotes the client-side authorization flow and is associated with the response_type=token parameter value.

member.name: T:Spring.Social.OAuth2.IOAuth2Operations
member.summary: A service interface for the OAuth 2 flow. This interface allows you to conduct the "OAuth dance" with a service provider on behalf of a user.
member.author: Keith Donald
Roy Clarkson
Bruno Baia (.NET)

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.IOAuth2Operations.BuildAuthorizeUrl(Spring.Social.OAuth2.GrantType,Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Parameters)
member.summary: Construct the URL to redirect the user to for authorization.
member.param: Specifies whether to use client-side or server-side OAuth flow.
Authorization parameters needed to build the URL. May be null.
member.returns: The absolute authorize URL to redirect the user to for authorization.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.IOAuth2Operations.BuildAuthenticateUrl(Spring.Social.OAuth2.GrantType,Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Parameters)
member.summary:
Construct the URL to redirect the user to for authentication.
The authenticate URL differs from the authorizationUrl slightly in that it does not require the user to authorize the app multiple times. This provides a better user experience for "Sign in with Provider" scenarios.
member.param: Specifies whether to use client-side or server-side OAuth flow.
Authorization parameters needed to build the URL. May be null.
member.returns: The absolute authenticate URL to redirect the user to for authorization.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.IOAuth2Operations.ExchangeForAccessAsync(System.String,System.String,Spring.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Action{Spring.Rest.Client.RestOperationCompletedEventArgs{Spring.Social.OAuth2.AccessGrant}})
member.summary: Exchange the authorization code for an access grant.
member.param: The authorization code returned by the provider upon user authorization.
The authorization callback url; this value must match the redirectUri registered with the provider.
Any additional parameters to be sent when exchanging the authorization code for an access grant. Should not be encoded.
The Action<T> to perform when the asynchronous request completes. Provides the OAuth2 access token.
member.returns: A instance that allows to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.IOAuth2Operations.RefreshAccessAsync(System.String,System.String,Spring.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Action{Spring.Rest.Client.RestOperationCompletedEventArgs{Spring.Social.OAuth2.AccessGrant}})
member.summary: Refreshes a previous access grant.
member.param: The refresh token from the previous access grant.
Optional scope to narrow to when refreshing access; if null, the existing scope is preserved.
Any additional parameters to be sent when refreshing a previous access grant. Should not be encoded.
The Action<T> to perform when the asynchronous request completes. Provides the OAuth2 access token.
member.returns: A instance that allows to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the authorization callback url.
This value must match the redirectUri registered with the provider.
This is optional per the OAuth 2 spec, but required by most OAuth 2 providers.

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Parameters.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the permissions the application is seeking with the authorization (optional).

member.name: P:Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Parameters.State
member.summary: Gets or sets an opaque key that must be included in the provider's authorization callback (optional).

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Template.BuildAuthorizeUrl(Spring.Social.OAuth2.GrantType,Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Parameters)
member.summary: Construct the URL to redirect the user to for authorization.
member.param: Specifies whether to use client-side or server-side OAuth flow.
Authorization parameters needed to build the URL. May be null.
member.returns: The absolute authorize URL to redirect the user to for authorization.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Template.BuildAuthenticateUrl(Spring.Social.OAuth2.GrantType,Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Parameters)
member.summary:
Construct the URL to redirect the user to for authentication.
The authenticate URL differs from the authorizationUrl slightly in that it does not require the user to authorize the app multiple times. This provides a better user experience for "Sign in with Provider" scenarios.
member.param: Specifies whether to use client-side or server-side OAuth flow.
Authorization parameters needed to build the URL. May be null.
member.returns: The absolute authenticate URL to redirect the user to for authorization.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Template.ExchangeForAccessAsync(System.String,System.String,Spring.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Action{Spring.Rest.Client.RestOperationCompletedEventArgs{Spring.Social.OAuth2.AccessGrant}})
member.summary: Exchange the authorization code for an access grant.
member.param: The authorization code returned by the provider upon user authorization.
The authorization callback url; this value must match the redirectUri registered with the provider.
Any additional parameters to be sent when exchanging the authorization code for an access grant. Should not be encoded.
The Action<T> to perform when the asynchronous request completes. Provides the OAuth2 access token.
member.returns: A instance that allows to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Template.RefreshAccessAsync(System.String,System.String,Spring.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Action{Spring.Rest.Client.RestOperationCompletedEventArgs{Spring.Social.OAuth2.AccessGrant}})
member.summary: Refreshes a previous access grant.
member.param: The refresh token from the previous access grant.
Optional scope to narrow to when refreshing access; if null, the existing scope is preserved.
Any additional parameters to be sent when refreshing a previous access grant. Should not be encoded.
The Action<T> to perform when the asynchronous request completes. Provides the OAuth2 access token.
member.returns: A instance that allows to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Template.CreateRestTemplate
member.summary: Creates the used to communicate with the provider's OAuth 2 API.
member.remarks: This implementation creates a RestTemplate with a minimal set of HTTP message converters: and . May be overridden to customize how the RestTemplate is created. For example, if the provider returns data in some format other than JSON for form-encoded, you might override to register an appropriate message converter.
member.returns: The RestTemplate used to perform OAuth2 calls.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Template.PostForAccessGrantAsync(System.String,Spring.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Action{Spring.Rest.Client.RestOperationCompletedEventArgs{Spring.Social.OAuth2.AccessGrant}})
member.summary: Asynchronously posts the request for an access grant to the provider.
member.remarks: The default implementation uses RestTemplate to request the access token and expects a JSON response to be bound to a dictionary. The information in the dictionary will be used to create an . Since the OAuth 2 specification indicates that an access token response should be in JSON format, there's often no need to override this method. If all you need to do is capture provider-specific data in the response, you should override CreateAccessGrant() instead. However, in the event of a provider whose access token response is non-JSON, you may need to override this method to request that the response be bound to something other than a dictionary. For example, if the access token response is given as form-encoded, this method should be overridden to call RestTemplate.PostForObject() asking for the response to be bound to a NameValueCollection (whose contents can then be used to create an ).
member.param: The URL of the provider's access token endpoint.
The request data to post to the access token endpoint.
The Action<T> to perform when the asynchronous request completes. Provides the OAuth2 access token.
member.returns: A instance that allows to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Spring.Social.OAuth2.OAuth2Template.CreateAccessGrant(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},Spring.Json.JsonValue)
member.summary: Creates an given the response from the access token exchange with the provider.
member.remarks: May be overridden to create a custom AccessGrant that captures provider-specific information from the access token response.
member.param: The access token value received from the provider.
The scope of the access token.
A refresh token value received from the provider.
The time (in seconds) remaining before the access token expires.
The JSON response received in the access token exchange.
member.returns: The OAuth2 access token.

member.name: T:Spring.Social.SocialException

member.remarks: This exception class is abstract, as it is too generic for actual use. When a is thrown, it should be one of the more specific subclasses.
